definition: worthwhile/to be a good deal/to be a bargain/to reckon up/to calculate
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]
to regard as/to figure/to calculate/to compute

sentences.english: Say so, business shop equallies shared the area is not Yue Xiaoyue economical.
sentences.chinese: 所以說，商鋪公攤面積並非越小越合算。

sentences.english: It pay to buy good machines. better quality usually means a higher price.
sentences.chinese: 購置好機器是合算的，質優通常意味着價高。

sentences.english: It would be uneconomical to send a brand new tape .
sentences.chinese: 寄一盤新磁帶過去不合算。

sentences.english: He didn't know how lucky he was to be a sensible man.
sentences.chinese: 司機不知道，有時學聰明點還是相當合算的。

sentences.english: Conventional TBMs were not judged cost-effective for battlefield use.
sentences.chinese: 傳統的戰術彈道導彈在戰場使用上的效率比並不合算。

sentences.english: She let her house at an economic rent.
sentences.chinese: 她以合算的方式把房子租出去。

sentences.english: Moreover, it's probably not money well spent -- at least in the developing world.
sentences.chinese: 再者，至少在發展中國家，撥款於加固工程不合算。

sentences.english: In Eastern Europe, you’ll find tempting deals on accommodation and have many tourist sights to yourself.
sentences.chinese: 在東歐，你會發現膳宿極爲合算，景點衆多。

sentences.english: But thatseemseemed like a lot of money to milk just one goat.
sentences.chinese: 但花這麼多錢只是爲了擠一頭羊的奶似乎不大合算。

sentences.english: He soon found that he had made a bad bargain.
sentences.chinese: 很快他就發現他做的是一筆不合算的生意。

sentences.english: It makes sense to buy a large packet because it works out cheaper in the end.
sentences.chinese: 買大包裝更合算，因爲大包裝終究要便宜些。

sentences.english: The first child always cuts straight down the middle so he won't get cheated.
sentences.chinese: 第一個孩子就會從正中間切下去要不然他就不合算。

sentences.english: How do we beneficially invest the land-use right?
sentences.chinese: 怎樣投資土地使權才合算？

sentences.english: This is a lucrative business, Symantec has discovered.
sentences.chinese: 賽門鐵克發現這是一項合算的生意。

sentences.english: There's no way that building and maintaining an airtight tube for any responsible distance would be cost effective.
sentences.chinese: 要建造和維護這樣密閉的管道根本就不合算。

definition: to calculate/to weigh (pros and cons)/to view as profitable/worthwhile/value for money/cost-effective
it isn't worth it/not cost-effective/not profitable/too expensive
cheap/inexpensive/small advantages/to let sb off lightly
troublesome/to take a lot of trouble to do sth
